TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NetTcpBinding extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding implements class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IBindingRuntimePreferences
Public Class NetTcpBinding Inherits Binding Implements IBindingRuntimePreferences
type NetTcpBinding = class inherit Binding interface IBindingRuntimePreferences

Docs.summary: A secure, reliable binding suitable for cross-machine communication.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding> generates a run-time communication stack by default, which uses transport security, TCP for message delivery, and a binary message encoding. This binding is an appropriate Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) system-provided choice for communicating over an Intranet.
The default configuration for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding> is faster than the configuration provided by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding>, but it is intended only for WCF communication. The security behavior is configurable using the optional `securityMode` parameter in the constructor. The use of WS-ReliableMessaging is configurable using the optional `reliableSessionEnabled` parameter. But reliable messaging is off by default. More generally, the HTTP system-provided bindings such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding> are configured to turn things on by default, whereas the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding> binding turns things off by default so that you have to opt-in to get support, for example, for one of the WS-* specifications. This means that the default configuration for TCP is faster at exchanging messages between endpoints than that configured for the HTTP bindings by default.
> [!WARNING] > The <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding> uses TCP connection pooling based on the service's host DNS name and the port number the service is listening on. This works well when a client makes calls to different services on different ports, or services are hosted in a single process and share a port. If a single client calls multiple services sharing a port that are hosted in different processes, or are WAS/IIS hosted, the client side pooling may lead to problems where a connection to Service A is reused for Service B, resulting in an exception being thrown, the connection aborted, and a new channel created. To avoid this problem, use a CustomBinding and specify a different ConnectionPoolSettings.GroupName for each service the client communicates with.
## Examples This example shows how to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding>, setting the security mode and transport credential type.
[!code-csharp[S_UENetTcpBinding#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uenettcpbinding/cs/source.cs#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The security behavior is configurable using the optional `securityMode` parameter in the constructor. The use of WS-ReliableMessaging is configurable using the optional `reliableSessionEnabled` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, transport security is used to secure communication (that is, the value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode.Transport>) and reliable sessions are disabled (that is <xref:System.ServiceModel.OptionalReliableSession.Enabled%2A> is `false`).
## Examples This example shows how to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding>, setting the security mode and transport credential type.
[!code-csharp[S_UENETTCPBINDING#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uenettcpbinding/cs/source.cs#1)]

Docs.param: The value that specifies the type of security used with the binding.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the type of security used specified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor when you want to configure the security. If you want to configure security and enable reliable sessions, use <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode%2CSystem.Boolean%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
## Examples This example shows how to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding> using the security mode parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ListenBacklog { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ListenBacklog : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of queued connection requests that can be pending.
Docs.value: The maximum number of pending queued connection requests. The default is 10.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TcpTransportBindingElement.ListenBacklog%2A> is a socket-level property that describes the number of "pending accept" requests to be queued. If the listen backlog queue fills up, new socket requests will be rejected.
## Examples This example shows how to get the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding.ListenBacklog%2A> value.
[!code-csharp[S_UENetTcpBinding#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uenettcpbinding/cs/source.cs#8)]

Docs.exception: The value cannot be less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property long MaxBufferPoolSize { long get(); void set(long value); };
member this.MaxBufferPoolSize : int64 with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, allowed for a buffer pool that stores TCP messages processed by the binding.
Docs.value: The maximum size allowed for a buffer pool that stores TCP messages processed by the binding. The default value is 524,288 bytes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you receive more data than you can buffer, the data that exceeds the buffer size remains on the underlying socket until your buffer has room for the rest of the data.
## Examples This example shows how to get the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A> value.
[!code-csharp[S_UENetTcpBinding#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uenettcpbinding/cs/source.cs#9)]

member this.MaxBufferSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer used to store messages in memory.
Docs.value: The maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer used to store messages in memory. The default value is 65,536 bytes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you receive more data than you can buffer, the data that exceeds the buffer size remains on the underlying socket until your buffer has room for the rest of the data.

member this.PortSharingEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether TCP port sharing is enabled for the connection configured with this binding.
Docs.value: if TCP port sharing is enabled; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Using this setting requires enabling the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) TCP Port Sharing Service by changing its startup type to Manual or Automatic.
For more information about the TCP Listener and how to start it, see <xref:System.Net.Sockets.TcpListener>.
## Examples This example shows how to get the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding.PortSharingEnabled%2A> value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Xml::XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas ^ ReaderQuotas { System::Xml::XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas ^ get(); void set(System::Xml::XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas ^ value); };
member this.ReaderQuotas : System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets constraints on the complexity of SOAP messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with this binding.
Docs.value: The that specifies the complexity constraints on soap messages exchanged. The default values for these constraints are provided in the following Remarks section.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The complexity constraints protect against a class of denial of service (DOS) attacks that attempt to use message complexity to tie up endpoint processing resources. The properties that express these constraints and their default values are as follows:
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxDepth%2A> = 32
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxStringContentLength%2A> = 8192
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxArrayLength%2A> = 16384
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxBytesPerRead%2A> = 4096
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxNameTableCharCount%2A> = 16384
## Examples The following example shows how to get the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding.ReaderQuotas%2A> object.
[!code-csharp[S_UENetTcpBinding#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uenettcpbinding/cs/source.cs#14)]

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property ReceiveSynchronously As Boolean Implements IBindingRuntimePreferences.ReceiveSynchronously

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether incoming requests are handled synchronously or asynchronously.
Docs.value: if incoming requests are handled synchronously; if incoming requests are handled asynchronously. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This run-time behavior for receiving messages in either a service or client application can be changed using [<synchronousReceive>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/synchronousreceive-element.md).
